sentence.Network_en: Never was husband more devoted, more respectful , more chivalrous. But love?

means.word_mean: 骑士的;殷勤的;有礼貌的

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the sense 'characteristic of a medieval knight'): from Old French chevalerous, from chevalier (see chevalier)

entry.tran: (男子)有骑士风度的;(尤指对女子)彬彬有礼的，殷勤的
entry.def: A chivalrous man is polite, kind, and unselfish, especially towards women.

example.ex: He was handsome, upright and chivalrous.
example.tran: 他长相英俊，为人正直，风度翩翩。

means.word_mean: 1. having the qualities of gallantry attributed to an ideal knight
